definitions.definition: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous
definitions.sensetop: hesitate about/over somethinghesitate about/over doing somethinghesitate about/over whether, how, etc…+ speech

examples.text: He seemed to hesitate a second.
When she hesitated over her order, the waiter gave her an impatient look.
I didn't hesitate for a moment about taking the job.
She stood there, hesitating over whether or not to tell him the truth.
Something about his smile made her hesitate.
I barely hesitated before saying yes.
I didn't hesitate about working with Craig.
He was hesitating between the noodles and the salad.

definitions.definition: to be worried about doing something, especially because you are not sure that it is right or appropriate

examples.text: Please **do not hesitate to** contact me if you have any queries.
If you'd like me to send you the book, then please don't hesitate to ask.
She never hesitated to speak her mind.

definitions.definition: if you delay in doing something you may lose a good opportunity

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from Latin haesitat- ‘stuck fast, left undecided’, from the verb haesitare, from haerere ‘stick, stay’.
